alternative_title: Employers' tax and reporting for clothing expenses
overview: Tax and reporting rules for employers providing clothing expenses and benefits, including uniforms and protective clothing
title: Expenses and benefits: clothing

table.body:
As an employer providing clothing to your employees, you have certain tax, National Insurance and reporting obligations.

##What's included

This includes purchase, cleaning and repair costs for all clothing. 

What you have to pay and report depends on if it's:

* protective clothing that your employee needs to do their job
* a uniform they only wear at work
table.title: Overview

table.body:
You don’t have to report anything to HMRC or pay tax and National Insurance if you:

* lend clothing to employees who earn [at a rate](/employer-reporting-introduction-to-expenses-and-benefits/calculate-earnings-at-a-rate "at a rate") of less than £8,500 a year
* pay to clean or repair protective clothing or uniforms for employees who earn [at a rate](/employer-reporting-introduction-to-expenses-and-benefits/calculate-earnings-at-a-rate "at a rate") of less than £8,500 a year

^You don't have to pay tax and National Insurance on most [uniforms](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM32475.htm "what counts as a uniform"){:rel="external"} or [protective clothing](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM32470.htm "protective clothing"), but you may still have to [report these expenses](/expenses-and-benefits-clothing/what-to-report-and-pay "report these expenses"){:rel="external"} to HMRC.^

*[HMRC]:HM Revenue & Customs
table.title: What's exempt

table.body:
If the clothing you provide isn’t [exempt](/expenses-and-benefits-clothing/whats-exempt "exempt"), you may have to report it to HMRC, and you may have to pay tax and National Insurance on the value.

##Uniforms or protective clothing

^If you provide uniforms or protective clothing, you can [apply for a dispensation](/apply-for-a-dispensation "apply for a dispensation"), which means you won't have to include them on your end-of-year reports.^

The following table shows what you have to do if you don't have a dispensation.

Expense | What to do | What to deduct or pay
-|-|-
Clothing you give to employees earning [at a rate](/employer-reporting-introduction-to-expenses-and-benefits/calculate-earnings-at-a-rate "at a rate") of less than £8,500 a year | Fill in form P9D, section A(2) | Nothing
Clothing you give to employees earning [at a rate](/employer-reporting-introduction-to-expenses-and-benefits/calculate-earnings-at-a-rate "at a rate") of £8,500 or more a year | Fill in form P11D, section A | Nothing
Clothing you give to directors | Fill in form P11D, section A | Nothing
Clothing you lend to employees earning [at a rate](/employer-reporting-introduction-to-expenses-and-benefits/calculate-earnings-at-a-rate "at a rate") of £8,500 or more a year | Fill in form P11D, section L | Nothing
Clothing you lend to directors | Fill in form P11D, section L | Nothing
Clothing you buy for employees earning [at a rate](/employer-reporting-introduction-to-expenses-and-benefits/calculate-earnings-at-a-rate "at a rate") of £8,500 or more a year | Fill in form P11D, section N | Nothing
Clothing you buy for directors | Fill in form P11D, section N | Nothing
Cleaning and repair costs for employees earning [at a rate](/employer-reporting-introduction-to-expenses-and-benefits/calculate-earnings-at-a-rate "at a rate") of £8,500 or more a year | Fill in form P11D, section N | Nothing
Cleaning and repair costs for directors | Fill in form P11D, section N | Nothing

##Any other clothing

This includes clothing employees wear at work that isn't necessary protective clothing or a uniform.

Expense | What to do | What to deduct or pay
-|-|-
Clothing you give to employees earning [at a rate](/employer-reporting-introduction-to-expenses-and-benefits/calculate-earnings-at-a-rate "at a rate") of less than £8,500 a year | Fill in form P9D, section A(2) | Nothing
Clothing you give to employees earning [at a rate](/employer-reporting-introduction-to-expenses-and-benefits/calculate-earnings-at-a-rate "at a rate") of £8,500 or more a year | Fill in form P11D, section A | Pay Class 1A National Insurance on the [value of the benefit](/expenses-and-benefits-clothing/work-out-the-value "value of the benefit")
Clothing you give to directors | Fill in form P11D, section A | Pay Class 1A National Insurance on the [value of the benefit](/expenses-and-benefits-clothing/work-out-the-value "value of the benefit")
Clothing you lend to employees earning [at a rate](/employer-reporting-introduction-to-expenses-and-benefits/calculate-earnings-at-a-rate "at a rate") of £8,500 or more a year | Fill in form P11D, section L | Pay Class 1A National Insurance on the [value of the benefit](/expenses-and-benefits-clothing/work-out-the-value "value of the benefit")
Clothing you lend to directors | Fill in form P11D, section L | Pay Class 1A National Insurance on the [value of the benefit](/expenses-and-benefits-clothing/work-out-the-value "value of the benefit")
Clothing any employees buy and you pay them back | Add the [value](/expenses-and-benefits-clothing/work-out-the-value "value") to your employee’s other earnings | Deduct and pay PAYE tax and Class 1 National Insurance through payroll
Non-durable clothing (eg tights and stockings) any employees buy and you pay them back | Add the [value](/expenses-and-benefits-clothing/work-out-the-value "value") to your employee’s other earnings | Deduct and pay PAYE tax (but not Class 1 National Insurance) through payroll
Cleaning and repair costs for any employees | Add the [value](/expenses-and-benefits-clothing/work-out-the-value "value") to your employee’s other earnings | Deduct and pay PAYE tax and Class 1 National Insurance through payroll

*[HMRC]:HM Revenue & Customs
*[PAYE]:Pay As You Earn
table.title: What to report and pay

table.body:
The value of clothing for tax and reporting depends on whether you give or lend it, who initially pays for it, and how much the employee earns.

##Clothing you give to employees 

If the employee earns [at a rate](/employer-reporting-introduction-to-expenses-and-benefits/calculate-earnings-at-a-rate "at a rate") of more than £8,500 a year, or is a director, use whichever is the higher of:

* the second-hand value of the clothing when you give it to your employee
* the initial cost to you of the clothing

If they earn [at a rate](/employer-reporting-introduction-to-expenses-and-benefits/calculate-earnings-at-a-rate "at a rate") of less than £8,500 a year, use the second-hand value of the clothing when you gave it to your employee.

##Clothing you lend to employees

Use whichever is the higher of:

* 20% of the clothing's market value when you first provided it
* any annual rental or hire charges you pay for it

##Clothing your employees buy and you pay them back for, or cleaning and repair costs

Use the amount of money you give you employee for the clothing, cleaning or repair.
